Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/25/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the
development of service plans to enable the
parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting
the agency in carrying out the plan. An agency
shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and
the child's family is confidential.
Three foster care case records and two independent living case records reviewed
did not indicate that the plan was developed with the parent/parents or foster
parents to enable the parent/parents/foster parents to understand the plan.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.

• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Special evaluation 2024C000124SE was initiated on 2/7/2024 regarding allegations
a licensed foster parent was digging her nails into a youth’s upper arm leaving scabs
and telling the youth she will end up in a juvenile home where she will be raped. The
licensed foster parent was found in violation of licensing rules. The evaluation was
thorough and well written. Revocation of the foster home license was initiated.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance was as follows:
Interim Inspection completed on 4/26/24 and CAP submitted on 5/10/24. The
agency was in violation with Rule 400. 12312, and Policy 722-08D. There was no
repeated violations during this reporting period. The agency is following their CAP.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator (CA) Assessment was reviewed. The CA reported the
interim corrective action plan of 2024 had a positive impact on obtaining
compliance with the CPA rules. She reported overall the agency’s compliance
with Act 116, licensing rules, policies and their contract has improved since the
last inspection. She reported there were many areas which the agency did well in
the past review period such as ongoing training of new staff and team meetings
regarding parent engagement, change of placement documentation and the
development of service plans.

Financial Overview:
The agency provided a copy of their audit completed by an independent certified
accountant dated 12/31/2023 and submitted 5/31/2024. The agency also
presented their annual budget for the Foster Care Program Bingham Farms. No
concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews:
Interviews were conducted with three staff. Staff reported feeling supported by
their supervisors, coworkers, and the administration. They all reported the work
environment is very positive, and they have no concerns. However, the staff
reported they wish the agency would look into a better staff insurance plan.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has adequate space and equipment to perform the required duties.
Files are stored securely and in a manner that provides unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
